arts.ttl: Hoeneß, Chabot and Undav react to Dortmund win
arts.sum: Following today's fantastic away win against Borussia Dortmund, Stuttgart head coach Sebastian Hoeneß gave his thoughts, alongside Deniz Undav and goalscorer Jeff Chabot.

arts.ttl: MOTM Poll: A Frustrated Dortmund Side Falls to Stuttgart
arts.sum: Julian Brandt managed to claw a goal back late in the game, but that ultimately didn’t matter. Spoiler alert—no BVB player had a straight up good game today, so it’s really slim pickings for the nominees.

arts.ttl: Leverkusen loses ground in Bundesliga title race, Dortmund loses again in Kovač’s debut
arts.sum: Bayer Leverkusen has been dealt a major blow to its Bundesliga title defense, and Borussia Dortmund’s malaise has continued through Niko Kovač’s debut as coach. Also Saturday, Dortmund lost 2-1 at home to Stuttgart in Kovač’s first game in charge.

arts.ttl: VfB Stuttgart ruin Niko Kovač's Borussia Dortmund debut
arts.sum: A Waldemar Anton own goal and strike from Jeff Chabot saw VfB Stuttgart ruin Niko Kovač's debut as Borussia Dortmund coach with a 2-1 win at Signal Iduna Park. Stuttgart doubled their lead in the 61st minute when Chabot volleyed home his first Bundesliga goal from close range after a Leweling cross.

arts.ttl: 15:30 Kickoffs: Huge wins for Stuttgart, Freiburg and Union Berlin, goalless draws in Wolfsburg and Mainz
arts.sum: On a dramatic afternoon across the Bundesliga, VfB Stuttgart, Union Berlin and SC Freiburg secured huge wins to get their league form back on track, whilst goalless draws containing Mainz, Augsburg, Wolfsburg and Bayer Leverkusen questioned the respective European and title credentials of Mainz and Bayer Leverkusen.

arts.ttl: £35m Arsenal target who has 'everything a striker needs' has now joined the same agency as Havertz and Mertesacker
arts.sum: Arsenal are one of several Premier League clubs who have been linked with Borussia Dortmund’s Karim Adeyemi in recent months. Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool, Manchester United, Tottenham...

arts.ttl: Match Preview: Niko Kovac Makes his BVB Coaching Debut
arts.sum: Unfortunately for BVB, he’s healthy again, and will be a big challenge for Niko Kovac to deal with on his debut. Kovac is the most experienced coach to lead BVB in years, and hopes are high that he can help right the ship of Dortmund’s struggling season and bring a sense of organization and purpose back to the club.
